}} 'Southern Television' was the first ITV broadcasting licence holder for the
south and south-east of England from 30 August 1958 until the night of 31
December 1981. The company was launched as Southern Television Limited and the
title Southern Television was consistently used on-air throughout its life.
However, in 1966 during the application process for contracts running from 1968
the company renamed itself Southern Independent Television Limited, a title
which was used until 1980, when the company reverted to its original corporate
name. Southern Television ceased broadcasting on the night of 31 December 1981
at 12.43am, after a review by the 1980 franchise round gave the contract to
Television South and set Southern's expiry at 9.30am.
